intro: Cynorkis ochyrae, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the Western Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color, blooming during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Cynorkis ochyrae is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region, with periods of drought tolerance.
